summary: Email chain from December 2021 discussing the location and status of Jeffrey Epstein's former yacht, 'The Dancing Hare' (previously named after Ghislaine Maxwell), which was docked in Palau. FBI personnel in Canberra and Palau coordinate to determine if U.S. case agents have interest in the vessel for potential search or seizure.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the person the yacht was previously named after before its name was changed to 'The Dancing Hare'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Identified as the former owner of the yacht 'The Dancing Hare'; the vessel's presence prompts FBI inquiry.

connections.description: Epstein's yacht was previously named after Maxwell, indicating a close personal or financial association.

events.title: Yacht arrival in Palau
events.description: The yacht 'The Dancing Hare' reportedly arrived in a Palau port.

events.title: Possible yacht arrival in Noumea
events.description: Tracking data suggests the yacht may have arrived in Noumea around mid-August 2021.

events.title: Yacht docked in New Zealand
events.description: The vessel spent much of 2020-2021 docked in various ports in New Zealand, particularly Westhaven, Auckland.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's former yacht, renamed 'The Dancing Hare', was located in Palau in December 2021, prompting FBI coordination to determine U.S. investigative interest.
The yacht was previously named after Ghislaine Maxwell, and its movements are tracked by conspiracy theorists due to the Epstein association.
The vessel spent significant time docked in New Zealand ports throughout 2020-2021, with prior docking in Sydney.
FBI personnel in Canberra and Palau discuss potential actions regarding the yacht, including search, seizure, or crew interviews.
Ownership of the yacht is described as 'murky,' linked to 'Moonstone Enterprises LLC,' and it is flagged in the Republic of the Marshall Islands (RMI).
